Posts.Content: It could be many things as the other poster had mentioned.   I, however, am experiencing left arm numbness, pain and tingling.  I have had it since about March.  I have it every day and it keeps me up at night.  It started prior to this with a stiff neck and I could hardly move my left arm.   I went to the chiropractor several times and it helped with the stiffness and neck issues.  However, I still have the numbness which is worse when I am trying to sleep.  I also have burniness in my left foot during the night (probably periphial neropothy).    I also saw my PCP.   I had a neck X-ray which showed degenerative discs.  They sent me for an EMG (nerve study test) which just said I had cervical radiculopthy (basically left arm numbness).  I then went and got a massage.  It really helped but I am still experiencing the numbness especially when I sleep. It is very annoying to say the least and worrysome too.   I also had an MRI of just my neck which really didn't show anything more than the x-ray.  I think they should have MRI my whole back though. If I find anything out I will let you know.   Kathy
Posts.Title: hand numbness

Posts.Content: Vicki Sam, Thanks for your wishes.   It seems ok during the day.  I still know it is there.   Taking motrin helps sometimes, but I don't like to take too much of it, especially since I have a ureter stent for my left kidney. lol - I sound like a sad sack, but I am still smiling  Kathy
Posts.Title: hand numbness

Posts.Content: I got 3 of these messages in a row at about 4 am
Posts.Title: SCAMMER ALERT!??

Posts.Content: My mom is HER2 positive - Stage 4 (invasive ductal) -  She only agreed to Herceptin treatment against doctors advice.  18 months later, her two lung nodules and the one lymph node were gone.  The main breast tumor shrunk enough for them to be able to do a lumpectomy.   She is still continuing treatment with Herceptin.  Recently, the doctors indicated that it was good she didn't do chemo since the Herceptin alone worked.  I would seek a second opinion.
Posts.Title: Treatment for HER2 Positive Small Tumor?

Posts.Content: my mom was diagnosed at age  80 with what you have.  it was in her left breast.   after a cat scan it was found a module in each lung.   Given the fact that my mom is independent she did not want chemo.  she would have opted for a lumpectomy but her tumor was too large.  So they put her on Herceptin only.  Within the year the liung nodules were gone and the left breast mass shrunk enough for them to do a lumpectomy.    She still is on Herceptin.    She goes every 3 weeks for her treatment.  No side effects.   She will be 86 in November.
Posts.Title: Treatment for HER2 Positive Small Tumor?
